text:
Hi Fraser, no worries I completely understand. Reply whenever you can :) 

I really loved compositing and VFX, just love seeing all the elements come together to make the final scene. 
What do you mean by production side of things? As in that phase or?
That's a big sign to focus on compositing in my opinion. Do you know your way around Nuke?
I am meaning in terms of producing and production management - if you have experience in this area, that is.

I know a basic level of Nuke, I’ve been learning through Youtube etc as I never had the opportunity to learn it in uni. 

I did a bit of producing for my graduate film and I enjoyed it! I really love organising and putting things together and managing all sorts. I’m always making lists in my head and I think I’m a decent communicator. I had to source out musicians and handle the budget for the graduate film and it was actually very enjoyable liaising with different departments

Sounds great. I would say that there are two suitable roles for you then, there's working as a Comp Artist and also a Producer. Each have their own paths and entry roles. What is quite suitable is that I work a lot as a Comp Artist and so will be able to give you some advice on this specifically. Where are you based?

That’s great! Thinking back, when I was in high school I always had this idea of working in VFX and working my way up to a producer type role but because there’s so many focus areas and not all will lead to producing in the long run, I think that’s what left me exploring so many other areas in VFX trying my hand at everything else. I’m based just outside of north London
